name: Flooded Chamber
short_description: A small dark chamber with its floor completely submerged in water. It is very dark aside from one torch.
long_description: The chamber is very dark aside from one torch. For the most part the floor looks like a shiny black mirror reflecting the torch light on its surface. You squint and spot a crack in the wall where the water is slowly trickling in. In one corner, a patch of dirt sticks up above the water's surface, enough room for a plant to grow here.

dark corridor.description: A stone corridor with an eerie light. You cannot see what is on the other side.

trapdoor.description: The cracked wooden trapdoor is raised far enough from the ground that it has avoided much of the room's moisture. The iron handle, rusted with age, is set in an equally-rusted iron plate with a strangely swirled keyhole.

wall.description: The stream from the wall is slow but constant. Must be from some underground reservoir.

pile of rubble.description: A pile of debris that seemed to have formed from sections of the roof and floor falling off.

flower.description: You've never seen a flower like this. Its blue petals have a bit of a shimmer to them. You wonder how it grew without sunlight.

torch.description: The torch on the wall burns as if it has just been lit. There is no sign of who lit it, but it could come in handy.
